content:
ChannelPoolSettings Class

In this Article

Specifies quotas for channels that belong to a pool of channels used by a service endpoint.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ChannelPoolSettings

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ChannelPoolSettings

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Quotas are used as a policy mechanism to prevent the consumption of excessive resources. They prevent Denial of Service (DOS) attacks that are either malicious or unintentional. Use this class when setting channel quotas on a custom channel.

ChannelPoolSettings specifies three quotas:

  • IdleTimeout to specify the maximum interval of time for which the channels in the pool can be idle before being closed.

  • LeaseTimeout to specify the interval of time after which a channel, when returned to the pool, is closed.

  • MaxOutboundChannelsPerEndpoint to specify the maximum number of channels that can be stored in the pool for each remote endpoint.

Constructors summary

ChannelPoolSettings()

Initializes a new instance of the ChannelPoolSettings class.

Properties summary

IdleTimeout

Get or sets the maximum interval of time for which the channels in the pool can be idle before being closed.
LeaseTimeout

Gets or sets the lifetime of a channel, after which it is closed.
MaxOutboundChannelsPerEndpoint

Gets or sets the maximum number of channels connecting to remote endpoints that can be initiated by the service.

Constructors

  • ChannelPoolSettings()

    Initializes a new instance of the ChannelPoolSettings class.

    public ChannelPoolSettings ();

    Remarks

    The default values set are:

    • IdleTimeout: 2 minutes.

    • LeaseTimeout: 10 minutes.

    • MaxOutboundChannelsPerEndpoint: 10 channels.

      These default quota values are based on a conservatively modest allocation of resources that are suitable for development environments and small installation scenarios. Service administrators should review channel quotas and tune individual quota values if an installation is running out of resources or if connections are being limited despite the availability of additional resources.

Properties

  • IdleTimeout

    Get or sets the maximum interval of time for which the channels in the pool can be idle before being closed.

    public TimeSpan IdleTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      The TimeSpan that specifies the maximum interval of time for which the channels in the pool can be idle before being closed. The default value is 2 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value is less than zero or greater than T:System.Int32.MaxValue in milliseconds.

    Remarks

    The IdleTimeout quota is used to mitigate Denial of Service (DOS) attacks on the server that rely on tying up resources for an extended period of time. On the client, setting the correct value can increase the reliability of connecting with the service. The default value is based on a conservatively modest allocation of resources. It is suitable for a development environment and small installation scenarios. Service administrators should review the value if an installation is running out of resources or if connections are being limited despite the availability of additional resources.

  • LeaseTimeout

    Gets or sets the lifetime of a channel, after which it is closed.

    public TimeSpan LeaseTimeout { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • TimeSpan

      A TimeSpan that specifies the lifetime of a channel, after which it is closed. The default value is 10 minutes.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value is less than zero.

    Remarks

    The LeaseTimeout quota is used to for integration with load balancers and for improving reliability. The default value is based on a conservative allocation of resources. It is suitable for a development environment and small installation scenarios. Service administrators should review the value if an installation is running out of resources or if connections are being limited despite the availability of additional resources.

  • MaxOutboundChannelsPerEndpoint

    Gets or sets the maximum number of channels connecting to remote endpoints that can be initiated by the service.

    public int MaxOutboundChannelsPerEndpoint { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      A positive integer that specifies the maximum number of channels to a remote endpoint in the pool that can be initiated by the service. The default value is 10 channels.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The value is less than zero.

    Remarks

    The MaxOutboundChannelsPerEndpoint quota sets cache limits on both the server and the client and is used to improve reliability. The default value is based on a conservatively modest allocation of resources that is suitable for a development environment and small installation scenarios. Service administrators should review the value if an installation is running out of resources or if connections are being limited despite the availability of additional resources.
